meta.note: Valuations reflect latest available data as of December 2025. Major tech companies valued at market cap.

openai.name: OpenAI
openai.founders: Sam Altman, Greg Brockman, Ilya Sutskever, Elon Musk, Wojciech Zaremba
openai.description: OpenAI created ChatGPT and GPT-4, the AI systems that sparked the generative AI revolution. As the leader in large language models, they continue advancing AI capabilities while focusing on safety and alignment.
openai.funding: $13B+ total funding. $10B from Microsoft (2023), $6.6B round at $157B valuation (Oct 2024)

anthropic.name: Anthropic
anthropic.valuation_note: Series F Dec 2025, $13B led by ICONIQ
anthropic.founders: Dario Amodei, Daniela Amodei, Tom Brown, Chris Olah, Sam McCandlish, Jared Kaplan
anthropic.description: Anthropic is an AI safety company building Claude, one of the most capable and safest AI assistants. Founded by former OpenAI researchers, they pioneer Constitutional AI and responsible AI development.
anthropic.funding: $8B+ total. $4B from Amazon, $2B from Google. Series E at $18B valuation (2024)

xai.name: xAI
xai.founders: Elon Musk, Igor Babuschkin, Tony Wu, Greg Yang
xai.description: xAI is Elon Musk's AI company building Grok, an AI assistant with real-time access to X (Twitter) data and a witty, unfiltered personality. They aim to build AI that helps humanity understand the universe.

databricks.name: Databricks
databricks.valuation_note: Series L Dec 16, 2025. Doubled from $60B in 12 months
databricks.founders: Ali Ghodsi, Ion Stoica, Matei Zaharia, Andy Konwinski, Reynold Xin, Patrick Wendell, Arsalan Tavakoli-Shiraji
databricks.description: Databricks unifies data engineering, analytics, and AI on one lakehouse platform. Their acquisition of Mosaic ML and DBRX model expanded them into foundation models while serving most Fortune 500 companies.

thinking_machines.name: Thinking Machines Lab
thinking_machines.valuation_note: In talks for $50B. Largest seed round ever ($2B)
thinking_machines.description: Thinking Machines Lab is a research-focused AI company working on fundamental advances in machine learning and reasoning capabilities. Their work spans large language models, multimodal understanding, and AI safety research, contributing to the broader scientific understanding of artificial intelligence.

figure.name: Figure AI
figure.valuation_note: Series C. Ended OpenAI partnership to build own AI.
figure.description: Figure AI is building general-purpose humanoid robots designed to work alongside humans. Their Figure 01 robot combines advanced AI with human-like form to perform tasks in warehouses, manufacturing, and eventually homes.

ssi.name: Safe Superintelligence
ssi.valuation_note: Raised $2B in April 2025. No product yet.
ssi.founders: Ilya Sutskever, Daniel Gross, Daniel Levy
ssi.description: Safe Superintelligence Inc. (SSI) is an AI research company founded by Ilya Sutskever, former OpenAI chief scientist and co-creator of GPT. Focused exclusively on building safe superintelligent AI, they represent one of the most ambitious and well-funded efforts in AI safety research.

anduril.name: Anduril Industries
anduril.founders: Palmer Luckey (Oculus founder), Brian Schimpf, Trae Stephens, Matt Grimm, Joe Chen
anduril.description: Anduril Industries builds advanced defense technology including autonomous systems, sensors, and AI-powered command and control. Their Lattice platform provides military-grade situational awareness.

cursor.name: Cursor (Anysphere)
cursor.valuation_note: Series D Nov 2025. $400M to $29.3B in 18 months
cursor.founders: Michael Truell, Sualeh Asif, Arvid Lunnemark, Aman Sanger
cursor.description: Cursor is an AI-first code editor built on VS Code, featuring deep AI integration for code completion, editing, and chat. It's become the preferred IDE for developers who want AI assistance throughout their workflow, not just autocomplete.

scaleai.name: Scale AI
scaleai.valuation_note: Meta $14.3B for 49%. Warning: private pricing as low as $7.3B
scaleai.description: Scale AI is the data infrastructure company powering the AI revolution. They provide data labeling, synthetic data generation, and model evaluation services to leading AI labs including OpenAI and Meta, making them critical to the development of frontier AI systems.

groq.name: Groq
groq.description: Groq builds custom AI inference chips (LPUs) that deliver the fastest LLM inference in the world. Their hardware enables real-time AI applications with sub-100ms latency for complex language models.

perplexity.name: Perplexity AI
perplexity.founders: Aravind Srinivas, Denis Yarats, Andy Konwinski, Johnny Ho
perplexity.description: Perplexity is the AI-powered answer engine that's reinventing search. Instead of links, it provides direct answers with citations, using real-time web access to deliver accurate, up-to-date information.

mistral.name: Mistral AI
mistral.valuation_note: Raised E1.7B Sept 2025. Europe's most valuable AI startup.
mistral.founders: Arthur Mensch, Guillaume Lample, Timoth√©e Lacroix
mistral.description: Mistral AI is a French AI company building efficient, open-weight large language models. Founded by former Google DeepMind and Meta researchers, they've released powerful models like Mixtral that rival larger competitors while being more accessible and deployable.

celonis.name: Celonis
celonis.founders: Alexander Rinke, Bastian Nominacher, Martin Klenk
celonis.description: Celonis is the global leader in process mining, using AI to analyze business processes and identify inefficiencies. Their execution management platform helps enterprises optimize operations and increase revenue.

nebius.name: Nebius Group
nebius.description: Nebius Group provides AI infrastructure and cloud services, emerging from Yandex's technology division. Their platform serves AI companies with GPU compute and storage at European data centers.

quantinuum.name: Quantinuum
quantinuum.description: Quantinuum is the world's largest integrated quantum computing company. Formed from Honeywell Quantum Solutions and Cambridge Quantum, they build full-stack quantum systems for enterprise and research.

1x.name: 1X Technologies
1x.description: 1X Technologies builds humanoid robots designed for real-world work. Their NEO robot combines AI with human-like form to assist in homes and workplaces, backed by OpenAI investment.

cognition.name: Cognition (Devin)
cognition.valuation_note: After Windsurf acquisition. ARR $1M to $73M in 9 months.
cognition.description: Cognition created Devin, the first AI software engineer capable of autonomously completing complex coding tasks. Devin can plan, write code, debug, and deploy‚Äîrepresenting a major leap toward AI that can truly assist in software development.

midjourney.name: Midjourney
midjourney.valuation_note: Self-funded, no official valuation. Zero VC.
midjourney.description: Midjourney is the leading AI image generation platform, known for producing stunning, artistic images from text prompts. Operating primarily through Discord, they've built a massive community of artists and creators who use their tool for everything from concept art to professional design work.

sierra.name: Sierra AI
sierra.description: Sierra AI builds conversational AI agents for customer service that feel genuinely helpful, not robotic. Founded by Salesforce co-founders, they focus on empathetic, effective AI interactions.

neura.name: Neura Robotics
neura.valuation_note: Tether in talks for E1B investment
neura.description: NEURA Robotics builds cognitive robots that can work safely alongside humans. Their MAiRA robots combine AI perception with human-like dexterity, enabling automation of complex manipulation tasks.

cerebras.name: Cerebras Systems
cerebras.founders: Andrew Feldman, Gary Lauterbach, Sean Lie, Jean-Philippe Fricker, Michael James
cerebras.description: Cerebras Systems created the world's largest chip, the Wafer Scale Engine, purpose-built for AI training. Their systems dramatically accelerate training of large models and are used by top AI research labs.

harvey.name: Harvey AI
harvey.valuation_note: Raised $760M in 2025. Half of AmLaw firms use Harvey.
harvey.description: Harvey AI provides legal AI that helps lawyers research, draft, and analyze documents. Built on advanced language models, it understands legal nuance and accelerates legal work.

ubtech.name: UBTECH Robotics
ubtech.valuation_note: First humanoid company to go public
ubtech.description: UBTECH Robotics creates humanoid robots for education, entertainment, and service. Their Walker robot and lineup of consumer robots have made them a leader in China's robotics industry.

glean.name: Glean
glean.valuation_note: Series F June 2025. $2.2B to $7.2B in 18 months.
glean.founders: Arvind Jain (ex-Google), TR Vishwanath, Tony Gentilcore, Piyush Prahladka
glean.description: Glean is an enterprise AI search platform that understands your company's knowledge across all apps and data sources. Their AI assistant helps employees find information, answer questions, and get work done faster.

cohere.name: Cohere
cohere.founders: Aidan Gomez, Ivan Zhang, Nick Frosst
cohere.description: Cohere provides enterprise-grade large language models for business applications. Their Command and Embed models power RAG systems, semantic search, and text generation across thousands of companies, with a focus on multilingual capabilities and enterprise security.

elevenlabs.name: ElevenLabs
elevenlabs.description: ElevenLabs is the leader in AI voice synthesis, offering hyper-realistic text-to-speech, voice cloning, and dubbing. Their technology powers audiobooks, video games, and content creation, with voices indistinguishable from human speech.

nuro.name: Nuro
nuro.valuation_note: Aug 2025 raise from Uber and Nvidia
nuro.description: Nuro builds autonomous delivery vehicles designed specifically for local commerce. Their driverless vehicles deliver groceries, food, and packages, reimagining last-mile delivery.

shield_ai.name: Shield AI
shield_ai.founders: Brandon Tseng, Ryan Tseng, Andrew Reiter
shield_ai.description: Shield AI develops autonomous systems for defense, including the Hivemind AI pilot that enables aircraft to fly and fight without GPS or communications. Their technology powers multiple military aircraft.

momenta.name: Momenta
momenta.valuation_note: Backed by Tencent, BMW, Toyota. IPO imminent.
momenta.description: Momenta develops autonomous driving technology using a data-driven approach. Their solutions span from advanced driver assistance to full autonomy, deployed with major automakers in China.

helsing.name: Helsing
helsing.founders: Gundbert Scherf, Torsten Reil, Niklas K√∂hler
helsing.description: Helsing is a European defense AI company building software that gives allied forces an edge. Their platform provides AI-powered analysis, targeting, and decision support for military operations.

abridge.name: Abridge
abridge.valuation_note: Series E June 2025. 2x valuation in 4 months.
abridge.description: Abridge uses AI to automatically generate clinical documentation from doctor-patient conversations. Their technology reduces physician burnout by eliminating hours of note-taking while improving documentation accuracy and completeness.

abnormal.name: Abnormal AI
abnormal.description: Abnormal Security uses behavioral AI to stop email attacks that evade traditional security. Their platform detects business email compromise, phishing, and account takeovers with high accuracy.

unconventional.name: Unconventional AI
unconventional.description: Unconventional AI provides specialized AI compute infrastructure designed for unconventional workloads. Their platform optimizes for emerging AI architectures and novel training approaches that don't fit traditional GPU paradigms.

huggingface.name: Hugging Face
huggingface.valuation_note: The GitHub of AI. Open-source model hub.
huggingface.founders: Cl√©ment Delangue, Julien Chaumond, Thomas Wolf
huggingface.description: Hugging Face is the GitHub of machine learning, hosting over 500,000 models and 250,000 datasets. Their Transformers library has become the standard for working with modern AI models, and their platform enables the entire AI community to share, collaborate, and deploy ML systems.

synthesia.name: Synthesia
synthesia.valuation_note: Oct 2025 led by GV. UK's most valuable GenAI.
synthesia.founders: Victor Riparbelli, Steffen Tjerrild, Lourdes Agapito, Matthias Niessner
synthesia.description: Synthesia is the leading AI video generation platform for enterprises, creating professional videos with AI avatars in 130+ languages. Used by half of Fortune 100 companies for training and marketing.

lambda.name: Lambda Labs
lambda.description: Lambda Labs provides GPU cloud infrastructure purpose-built for AI training and inference. Their on-demand and reserved GPU clusters power research labs and startups, with competitive pricing and deep learning-optimized software stack.

runway.name: Runway
runway.valuation_note: Series D April 2025. Gen-4.5 beats Google/OpenAI.
runway.founders: Crist√≥bal Valenzuela, Alejandro Matamala, Anastasis Germanidis
runway.description: Runway is pioneering AI-powered creative tools for video editing and generation. Their Gen-2 and Gen-3 models enable text-to-video creation, while their suite of AI tools for motion tracking, background removal, and editing has made them essential for filmmakers and content creators.

pika.name: Pika Labs
pika.description: Pika Labs creates AI video generation technology that transforms text and images into high-quality video clips. Their intuitive platform makes video creation accessible to everyone, from social media creators to professional studios.

addepar.name: Addepar
addepar.description: Addepar is the wealth management platform that brings clarity to complex investment portfolios. Their technology aggregates data from thousands of sources, providing advisors and institutions with a unified view of assets across custodians.

replit.name: Replit
replit.founders: Amjad Masad, Faris Masad, Haya Odeh
replit.description: Replit is a browser-based development environment with powerful AI features including Ghostwriter for code generation. They're building the future of collaborative, AI-augmented software development with millions of developers using their platform.

poolside.name: Poolside
poolside.description: Poolside AI is building next-generation code AI using reinforcement learning from code execution. Founded by the former GitHub CTO, they're developing AI that truly understands programming through interaction with running code.

wayve.name: Wayve
wayve.valuation_note: Raised $1.05B from SoftBank. UK's largest AI deal.
wayve.description: Wayve builds autonomous vehicles that learn to drive through experience. Their AV2.0 approach uses end-to-end AI that generalizes across cities, avoiding the brittleness of traditional autonomous systems.

sakana.name: Sakana AI
sakana.founders: Llion Jones, Ren Ito, David Ha
sakana.description: Sakana AI is a Tokyo-based lab founded by former Google researchers, developing AI models inspired by nature and evolution. Their research focuses on efficient, adaptive AI systems using novel architectures beyond traditional transformers.

tenstorrent.name: Tenstorrent
tenstorrent.valuation_note: In talks for $800M at $3B+. Led by Jim Keller.
tenstorrent.founders: Ljubisa Bajic, Jim Keller (ex-Apple, AMD, Tesla)
tenstorrent.description: Tenstorrent, led by legendary chip architect Jim Keller, builds AI processors using RISC-V architecture. Their chips target both training and inference with a focus on efficiency and scalability.

gamma.name: Gamma
gamma.founders: Grant Lee, Jon Noronha, James Fox
gamma.description: Gamma reimagines presentations with AI that generates engaging slides, documents, and websites from your ideas. Their visual-first approach makes creating polished content fast and effortless.

xtalpi.name: XtalPi
xtalpi.description: XtalPi uses quantum physics and AI to predict molecular properties for drug discovery. Their platform accelerates pharmaceutical R&D by simulating how drugs will behave before they're synthesized.

lovable.name: Lovable
lovable.valuation_note: Fastest-growing startup ever. $0 to $100M ARR in 8 months.
lovable.description: Lovable (formerly GPT Engineer) turns natural language into full-stack web applications. You describe what you want, and it generates complete, deployable code with a visual interface for iteration.

bot_company.name: The Bot Company
bot_company.description: The Bot Company is building autonomous humanoid robots for the workforce. Their robots aim to perform general physical tasks in homes and workplaces, addressing labor shortages with AI embodiment.

writer.name: Writer
writer.description: Writer provides AI writing assistance purpose-built for enterprises, with brand consistency, style guides, and security controls. They help large organizations maintain quality across all written content.

hippocratic.name: Hippocratic AI
hippocratic.description: Hippocratic AI builds AI healthcare agents designed to be safe and effective for patient interactions. Their focus on healthcare-specific training ensures AI assistants that truly understand medical contexts.

sambanova.name: SambaNova Systems
sambanova.founders: Rodrigo Liang, Christopher R√©, Kunle Olukotun
sambanova.description: SambaNova Systems builds AI chips and systems designed for training and inference at enterprise scale. Their Reconfigurable Dataflow Architecture offers an alternative to GPUs for large-scale AI workloads.

jasper.name: Jasper
jasper.founders: Dave Rogenmoser, Chris Hull, John Philip Morgan
jasper.description: Jasper is the AI marketing platform that helps teams create on-brand content at scale. Their tools generate ads, blog posts, and marketing copy while maintaining consistent brand voice.

magic.name: Magic AI
magic.description: Magic AI is building a next-generation AI software engineer with exceptionally long context. Their models can hold millions of tokens, enabling understanding of entire codebases and producing more coherent, architecturally-sound code changes.

apptronik.name: Apptronik
apptronik.valuation_note: Series B Feb 2025. Amazon, Walmart, Mercedes.
apptronik.founders: Jeff Cardenas, Nick Paine, Luis Sentis
apptronik.description: Apptronik builds humanoid robots designed for real-world work. Their Apollo robot is being developed for manufacturing, logistics, and other industries where human-form robots can integrate naturally.

intercom.name: Intercom
intercom.valuation_note: Invested $100M in AI. Fin answered 13M inquiries.
intercom.description: Intercom is a customer service platform powered by AI, featuring Fin, an AI agent that resolves customer issues automatically. They combine chatbots, help centers, and human support into one seamless experience.

ai21.name: AI21 Labs
ai21.valuation_note: Series C from Google and Nvidia
ai21.description: AI21 Labs builds enterprise-grade language models including Jamba, a novel hybrid architecture combining transformers and state space models. Their Wordtune writing assistant reaches millions of users.

tines.name: Tines
tines.description: Tines is the smart, secure workflow platform for enterprise security teams. Their no-code automation enables security operations to build sophisticated playbooks without programming.

together_ai.name: Together AI
together_ai.valuation_note: GPU cloud for startups. Pay per token.
together_ai.founders: Vipul Ved Prakash, Ce Zhang, Percy Liang, Christopher R√©
together_ai.description: Together AI provides cloud infrastructure optimized for open-source LLMs. Their platform offers the fastest inference speeds for models like Llama and Mixtral, with competitive pricing that makes open AI models practical for production use.

resolve.name: Resolve AI
resolve.description: Resolve AI automates customer support with AI agents that handle complex issues. Their technology goes beyond simple chatbots to truly resolve problems, reducing ticket volume while improving satisfaction.

world_labs.name: World Labs
world_labs.description: World Labs is an AI company founded by Fei-Fei Li, the legendary Stanford professor who created ImageNet. They're building large world models that understand spatial intelligence and physics, aiming to give AI systems genuine understanding of the 3D world.

reka.name: Reka AI
reka.description: Reka AI builds multimodal foundation models that understand text, images, and video. Founded by former Google DeepMind researchers, their Reka Core and Flash models compete with leading multimodal AI systems.

stability.name: Stability AI
stability.description: Stability AI is the company behind Stable Diffusion, the most widely-used open-source image generation model. They champion open AI development and have expanded into video (Stable Video), audio, and 3D generation, enabling a vast ecosystem of creative applications.

generate_bio.name: Generate:Biomedicines
generate_bio.valuation_note: Generative AI for proteins. AstraZeneca deal.
generate_bio.description: Generate Biomedicines designs new protein therapeutics with generative AI. Their platform creates novel proteins optimized for specific functions, opening new possibilities in medicine beyond natural proteins.

insilico.name: Insilico Medicine
insilico.description: Insilico Medicine uses AI to discover new drugs and identify targets for diseases of aging. They've advanced multiple AI-discovered drugs to clinical trials, validating their end-to-end platform.

sanctuary_ai.name: Sanctuary AI
sanctuary_ai.description: Sanctuary AI is building humanoid robots with human-like intelligence. Their Phoenix robot combines advanced AI with human form to work in unstructured environments alongside people.

dream_security.name: Dream Security
dream_security.description: Dream Security provides AI-powered security operations for enterprise. Their platform uses advanced AI to detect threats, automate response, and reduce the burden on security teams.

augment.name: Augment Code
augment.valuation_note: Series B. Better than Copilot claims.
augment.description: Augment Code is building AI that truly understands your codebase. Their system indexes and reasons over entire repositories, providing contextually-aware code suggestions that respect your architecture, patterns, and conventions.

sardine.name: Sardine
sardine.valuation_note: Series C Feb 2025. AI fraud prevention.
sardine.description: Sardine provides fraud and compliance infrastructure for fintech. Their platform uses device intelligence and behavioral biometrics to detect fraud and money laundering in real-time.

decagon.name: Decagon
decagon.description: Decagon builds enterprise-grade AI support agents that handle customer conversations autonomously. Their platform integrates with existing systems to resolve issues with human-like understanding and accuracy.

heygen.name: HeyGen
heygen.description: HeyGen creates AI-generated videos with realistic avatars that speak any language. Their technology powers marketing, training, and communication videos without cameras or actors.

aleph_alpha.name: Aleph Alpha
aleph_alpha.description: Aleph Alpha is building sovereign European AI infrastructure and foundation models. Their Luminous models serve government and enterprise clients requiring data sovereignty and transparency.

hawk_ai.name: Hawk AI
hawk_ai.description: Hawk AI fights financial crime with AI-powered surveillance and screening. Their platform helps banks and fintechs detect money laundering, fraud, and sanctions violations more effectively.

reflection_ai.name: Reflection AI
reflection_ai.valuation_note: Raised $2B. Open frontier AI lab challenging DeepSeek.
reflection_ai.description: Reflection AI is developing next-generation language models with improved reasoning and self-reflection capabilities. Their research focuses on models that can evaluate their own outputs and iteratively improve their responses for greater accuracy.

physical_intelligence.name: Physical Intelligence
physical_intelligence.valuation_note: Series B Nov 2025. 'Android for robots' - $300/month per robot.
physical_intelligence.founders: Karol Hausman, Sergey Levine, Chelsea Finn, Brian Ichter
physical_intelligence.description: Physical Intelligence (œÄ) is building foundation models for robotics. Their approach brings the generalization capabilities of large language models to physical AI systems.

sandboxaq.name: SandboxAQ
sandboxaq.valuation_note: Series E $450M. Alphabet spinout. TIME100 Most Influential 2025.
sandboxaq.description: SandboxAQ applies AI and quantum technologies to solve complex enterprise problems. Their platforms address drug discovery, cybersecurity, and financial modeling with advanced computational approaches.

codeium.name: Codeium
codeium.description: Codeium provides free AI code completion and chat for developers, supporting 70+ languages across all major IDEs. Their Windsurf agentic IDE and enterprise features compete directly with GitHub Copilot.

n8n.name: n8n
n8n.valuation_note: Series C led by Accel. AI agent automation platform.
n8n.description: n8n is the open-source workflow automation platform that gives you full control over your data and deployments. Their visual builder and self-hosting options appeal to technical teams.

xaira.name: Xaira Therapeutics
xaira.description: Xaira Therapeutics uses AI to design precision medicines that target disease at the molecular level. Their platform integrates AI throughout the drug development process, from target discovery to clinical design.

langchain.name: LangChain
langchain.valuation_note: Series B led by IVP. AI agent deployment platform.
langchain.description: LangChain is the most popular framework for building LLM-powered applications. Their tools for chaining prompts, connecting to data sources, and building agents have become essential infrastructure for AI app developers.

enveda.name: Enveda Biosciences
enveda.valuation_note: Series D $150M. AI mines nature for drugs.
enveda.description: Enveda Biosciences uses AI to discover medicines from nature's chemistry. Their platform analyzes plants and natural products to find new drug candidates, combining traditional knowledge with modern AI.

isomorphic.name: Isomorphic Labs
isomorphic.valuation_note: Raised $600M April 2025. AlphaFold for drug discovery.
isomorphic.description: Isomorphic Labs, an Alphabet company, applies AI to drug discovery using technologies from DeepMind including AlphaFold. They partner with pharma companies to accelerate drug development.

insitro.name: Insitro
insitro.valuation_note: ML for drug discovery. Partnership with Bristol Myers Squibb.
insitro.description: Insitro combines machine learning with biological data to discover and develop drugs. Their approach generates rich datasets from human cell models to predict clinical outcomes.

imbue.name: Imbue
imbue.description: Imbue is building AI systems that can reason and collaborate with humans. Their research focuses on developing AI agents that understand user intent and work effectively on complex, open-ended tasks.

braintrustdata.name: Braintrust
braintrustdata.description: Braintrust is the enterprise AI platform for evaluating, testing, and monitoring LLM applications. Their tools help teams measure model quality, run experiments, and catch regressions before they affect users.

baseten.name: Baseten
baseten.founders: Tuhin Srivastava, Amir Haghighat, Philip Howes
baseten.description: Baseten provides inference infrastructure optimized for machine learning models. Their platform handles the complexity of deploying, scaling, and monitoring ML in production, trusted by companies processing millions of AI requests daily.

modal.name: Modal
modal.description: Modal is serverless infrastructure that makes running Python in the cloud feel like running it locally. Their platform handles GPU allocation, scaling, and orchestration automatically, perfect for AI workloads that need to scale dynamically.

character_ai.name: Character.AI
character_ai.valuation_note: Google licensing deal $2.5B. Founders returned to Google.
character_ai.founders: Noam Shazeer, Daniel De Freitas (ex-Google LaMDA)
character_ai.description: Character.AI lets users create and chat with AI characters, from fictional personas to educational tutors. With billions of messages exchanged, they've built one of the most engaged AI consumer products.

typeface.name: Typeface
typeface.description: Typeface is the generative AI platform for enterprise content creation. Their technology enables brands to create on-brand marketing content at scale while maintaining consistency and compliance.

anthropic_spinout.name: Goodfire
anthropic_spinout.description: Goodfire is an AI interpretability company spun out of Anthropic, focused on understanding how neural networks actually work. Their research aims to make AI systems more transparent and trustworthy by revealing the internal mechanisms of large language models.

emergence.name: Emergence AI
emergence.description: Emergence AI builds autonomous AI agents for enterprise workflows. Their technology enables AI to operate independently within business processes, handling complex multi-step tasks with minimal oversight.

fixed_ai.name: Fix
fixed_ai.description: Fix is an AI-powered development platform that automatically fixes bugs and issues in code. Their system analyzes errors, understands context, and generates corrections, streamlining the debugging process for development teams.

dbt_labs.name: dbt Labs
dbt_labs.founders: Tristan Handy, Drew Banin, Connor McArthur
dbt_labs.description: dbt Labs created the analytics engineering workflow with dbt (data build tool). Their platform helps data teams transform raw data into trusted datasets using software engineering best practices.

hex.name: Hex
hex.founders: Barry McCardel, Caitlin Colgrove, Glen Takahashi
hex.description: Hex is the modern data workspace where teams collaborate on analytics with notebooks, SQL, and AI. Their platform combines the best of notebooks and BI tools with powerful collaboration features.

fivetran.name: Fivetran
fivetran.description: Fivetran automates data integration, syncing data from hundreds of sources into your warehouse. Their platform eliminates the engineering work of building and maintaining data pipelines.

airbyte.name: Airbyte
airbyte.description: Airbyte is the open-source data integration platform with 300+ connectors. Their EL(T) approach enables data teams to sync data from any source to any destination.

pinecone.name: Pinecone
pinecone.description: Pinecone is the most popular vector database, enabling semantic search and AI memory at scale. Their managed service makes it easy to build RAG applications and AI features that truly understand meaning.

qdrant.name: Qdrant
qdrant.description: Qdrant is a high-performance vector similarity search engine built in Rust. Their open-source database excels at filtering, payload handling, and scaling to billions of vectors.

weaviate.name: Weaviate
weaviate.description: Weaviate is an open-source vector database that stores data objects and vector embeddings for semantic search and AI applications. Their hybrid search combines vector similarity with traditional filtering.

luma_ai.name: Luma AI
luma_ai.description: Luma AI creates photorealistic 3D captures and AI-generated videos. Their Dream Machine model generates high-quality video from text, while their 3D scanning makes reality capture accessible.

snowflake.name: Snowflake
snowflake.founders: Benoit Dageville, Thierry Cruanes, Marcin Zukowski
snowflake.description: Snowflake is the data cloud company that has expanded into AI with Cortex, their suite of AI services. Built on their data warehouse platform used by thousands of enterprises, Snowflake Cortex brings LLMs and ML directly to where enterprise data lives.

palantir.name: Palantir Technologies
palantir.valuation_note: NASDAQ: PLTR. 22nd most valuable company globally.
palantir.founders: Peter Thiel, Alex Karp, Joe Lonsdale, Stephen Cohen, Nathan Gettings
palantir.description: Palantir builds data integration and AI platforms for government and enterprise. Their Gotham and Foundry platforms help organizations make sense of complex data for critical decisions.

nvidia.name: NVIDIA
nvidia.valuation_note: NASDAQ: NVDA. World's most valuable company.
nvidia.founders: Jensen Huang, Chris Malachowsky, Curtis Priem
nvidia.description: NVIDIA dominates AI computing with GPUs that power virtually all AI training and inference. Their H100 and upcoming Blackwell chips, combined with CUDA software ecosystem, make them the most valuable semiconductor company in the world.

google_deepmind.name: Google DeepMind
google_deepmind.valuation_note: Alphabet subsidiary. Created AlphaGo, AlphaFold, Gemini.
google_deepmind.founders: Demis Hassabis, Shane Legg, Mustafa Suleyman
google_deepmind.description: Google DeepMind combines two of the world's premier AI research labs into one powerhouse. Their work spans from AlphaFold's solution to protein structure prediction to Gemini, pushing the boundaries of what AI can achieve in science and applications.

meta_ai.name: Meta AI (Llama)
meta_ai.description: Meta AI develops Llama, the leading open-source large language model family. Their research advances computer vision, language understanding, and mixed reality, powering AI features across Meta's products.

waymo.name: Waymo
waymo.founders: Sebastian Thrun (originally Google Self-Driving Car Project)
waymo.description: Waymo is the autonomous driving subsidiary of Alphabet, operating commercial robotaxi services in multiple US cities. With millions of miles of real-world driving, they're the leader in deploying self-driving technology at scale.

boston_dynamics.name: Boston Dynamics

boston_dynamics.description: Boston Dynamics creates the world's most advanced mobile robots, from Spot the robot dog to Atlas the humanoid. Their robots demonstrate remarkable agility and are used for inspection, safety, and research.

uipath.name: UiPath
uipath.description: UiPath is the leader in robotic process automation (RPA), using AI to automate repetitive business processes. Their platform combines software robots with AI to handle complex workflows.

github_copilot.name: GitHub Copilot
github_copilot.description: GitHub Copilot is the AI pair programmer that transformed software development. Integrated into popular IDEs, it suggests code completions, generates functions, and explains code, used by millions of developers worldwide.

sora.name: OpenAI Sora
sora.description: Sora is OpenAI's breakthrough text-to-video model that generates realistic, minute-long videos from prompts. Its understanding of physics and motion represents a major leap in AI video generation, with implications for film, advertising, and creative industries.

tesla_optimus.name: Tesla Optimus

servicenow.name: ServiceNow
servicenow.description: ServiceNow is the enterprise workflow platform that digitizes and automates business processes. Their Now Platform AI capabilities transform how organizations manage IT, HR, customer service, and more.

crowdstrike.name: CrowdStrike
crowdstrike.description: CrowdStrike is the leader in cloud-native endpoint security, using AI to detect and prevent cyber threats in real-time. Their Falcon platform protects millions of endpoints worldwide with industry-leading threat intelligence.

adobe_firefly.name: Adobe Firefly
adobe_firefly.description: Adobe Firefly is Adobe's family of generative AI models trained on licensed content. Integrated into Photoshop, Illustrator, and other Creative Cloud apps, it enables professional-safe AI generation for commercial work.

zendesk.name: Zendesk
zendesk.founders: Mikkel Svane, Alexander Aghassipour, Morten Primdahl
zendesk.description: Zendesk is the customer service platform trusted by 100,000+ businesses, now enhanced with AI for automated responses, agent assistance, and intelligent ticket routing.

zapier.name: Zapier
zapier.founders: Wade Foster, Bryan Helmig, Mike Knoop
zapier.description: Zapier connects 6,000+ apps to automate workflows without code. Their AI features now help users build automations with natural language, making process automation accessible to everyone.

recursion.name: Recursion Pharmaceuticals

recursion.description: Recursion Pharmaceuticals combines AI, automation, and biology to discover new drugs. Their platform generates massive biological datasets and uses machine learning to identify drug candidates faster than traditional methods.

agility_robotics.name: Agility Robotics
agility_robotics.description: Agility Robotics builds Digit, a human-centric robot designed to work in spaces built for people. Their bipedal robot navigates stairs, carries boxes, and collaborates safely with human workers.

tabnine.name: Tabnine
tabnine.description: Tabnine provides AI code completion that runs locally or in the cloud, with a focus on privacy and enterprise security. They support all major languages and IDEs with personalized suggestions.

replicate.name: Replicate
replicate.description: Replicate lets developers run open-source AI models with a single API call. Their platform hosts thousands of models from image generators to language models, making cutting-edge AI accessible without managing infrastructure.

labelbox.name: Labelbox

labelbox.description: Labelbox is the leading data labeling platform for training AI models. Their tools for annotation, model-assisted labeling, and data curation help teams build high-quality training datasets faster, with over 30% of Fortune 500 companies as customers.

coveo.name: Coveo

aws_sagemaker.name: Amazon SageMaker

aws_bedrock.name: Amazon Bedrock

amazon_q.name: Amazon Q
amazon_q.description: Amazon Q is AWS's generative AI assistant for business and development. It helps developers write code, troubleshoot errors, and build on AWS, while business users analyze data and automate workflows with natural language.

amazon_titan.name: Amazon Titan
amazon_titan.description: Amazon Titan is AWS's family of foundation models for text, images, and embeddings. Available through Bedrock, these models enable enterprises to build generative AI applications on AWS infrastructure with consistent quality.

aws.name: Amazon Web Services
aws.description: Amazon Web Services dominates cloud computing with AI services from SageMaker to Bedrock. Their AI/ML infrastructure supports model training, deployment, and inference at massive scale for enterprises worldwide.

aws_redshift.name: Amazon Redshift
aws_redshift.description: Amazon Redshift is the cloud data warehouse that scales from gigabytes to petabytes. Its machine learning capabilities enable predictive analytics directly on enterprise data.

google_cloud.name: Google Cloud Platform
google_cloud.description: Google Cloud Platform provides enterprise cloud services powered by Google's AI. From BigQuery to Vertex AI, it enables businesses to build on the same infrastructure as Google.

google_vertex.name: Google Vertex AI
google_vertex.description: Google Vertex AI is the unified ML platform for training and deploying models. It provides access to Gemini models, AutoML, and MLOps tools for enterprise AI development.

google_bigquery.name: Google BigQuery

google_gemini.name: Google Gemini

google_deepmind_robotics.name: Google DeepMind Robotics

azure_openai.name: Azure OpenAI Service

microsoft_fabric.name: Microsoft Fabric

microsoft_power_automate.name: Microsoft Power Automate

github_copilot_workspace.name: GitHub Copilot Workspace

github_codespaces.name: GitHub Codespaces

jetbrains_ai.name: JetBrains AI

artisan_ai.name: Artisan AI

aomni.description: Aomni is the AI research agent for sales teams. Their platform automatically researches accounts, identifies opportunities, and generates insights that help reps personalize outreach.

csm_ai.name: CSM (Common Sense Machines)

riffusion.name: Riffusion
riffusion.description: Riffusion pioneered AI music generation by treating audio as visual spectrograms. Their innovative approach fine-tuned Stable Diffusion on spectrogram images, creating the first model that could generate music from text prompts in real-time.

krea.name: Krea
krea.description: Krea is an AI-powered creative platform that lets designers generate and enhance images in real-time. Their tools enable rapid iteration with instant visual feedback, changing how creative professionals approach design workflows.

magnific.name: Magnific AI
magnific.description: Magnific AI specializes in AI image upscaling and enhancement with remarkable detail preservation. Their technology can increase image resolution while hallucinating plausible fine details, transforming low-resolution images into stunning high-resolution artwork.

freepik_ai.name: Freepik AI

codegen.name: Codegen

ellipsis.name: Ellipsis

greptile.name: Greptile

noetik_ai.description: Noetik AI uses multimodal AI to accelerate drug discovery and development. Their platform analyzes diverse biological data to identify promising therapeutic approaches and predict clinical outcomes.

profluent.name: Profluent Bio

notable_health.description: Notable Health automates healthcare workflows with intelligent automation. Their platform handles administrative tasks from scheduling to billing, reducing staff burden and improving the patient experience.

elation_health.name: Elation Health
elation_health.description: Elation Health provides the clinical-first EHR designed for primary care. Their AI-enhanced platform prioritizes the doctor-patient relationship while automating documentation and administrative work.

evotec.name: Evotec
evotec.description: Evotec is a drug discovery and development company leveraging AI and automation. Their integrated platform combines biology, data science, and chemistry to accelerate the path from target to clinic.

plus_one_robotics.name: Plus One Robotics
plus_one_robotics.description: Plus One Robotics provides AI-powered pick-and-place robots for warehouses. Their technology handles the variability of e-commerce fulfillment, with human supervisors assisting when needed.

dexterity_robotics.name: Dexterity
dexterity_robotics.description: Dexterity provides AI-powered robotic systems for warehouse logistics. Their robots handle the variability of e-commerce fulfillment, picking and packing diverse items with human-like adaptability.

ambi_robotics.name: Ambi Robotics
ambi_robotics.description: Ambi Robotics uses AI to enable robots to pick and sort packages in warehouses. Their technology handles the diversity of items in logistics with human-like adaptability.

vercel_ai.name: Vercel
vercel_ai.description: Vercel provides the leading platform for frontend deployment and AI applications. Their AI SDK and edge infrastructure power millions of web applications, with seamless integration for AI features.

railway.name: Railway
railway.description: Railway is the modern platform for deploying any application instantly. Their infrastructure handles databases, workers, and services with simple deploys, making production deployment accessible to all developers.

crayon_intel.name: Crayon
crayon_intel.description: Crayon provides competitive intelligence software powered by AI. Their platform tracks competitor activities across millions of sources, enabling teams to win more deals with real-time market insights.

klue.name: Klue
klue.description: Klue is the competitive enablement platform that helps sales teams win against competitors. Their AI collects intel, creates battle cards, and surfaces insights when reps need them most.

clay.name: Clay
clay.description: Clay enriches contact data from 75+ sources to power personalized outreach. Their platform automates research and data enrichment, enabling sales teams to write relevant messages at scale.

marqo.name: Marqo
marqo.description: Marqo is the end-to-end vector search engine for AI applications. Their platform handles embedding, indexing, and search in one system, simplifying semantic search development.

turbopuffer.name: Turbopuffer
turbopuffer.description: Turbopuffer provides serverless vector search at massive scale. Their platform enables semantic search and RAG with simple APIs, handling billions of vectors without infrastructure management.

tecton.name: Tecton
tecton.description: Feature platform for ML and real-time AI.
tecton.founders: Kevin Stumpf, Mike Del Balso, Jeremy Hermann

mythic.name: Mythic
mythic.description: Analog compute AI chips for edge inference.

talkie.name: Talkie AI
talkie.description: Talkie AI provides AI companions for conversation and roleplay. Their platform enables users to create and interact with customizable AI characters for entertainment and companionship.
